extendedIngredients.name: celery
extendedIngredients.original: 1 head of celery, thinly sliced (6 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: edamame
extendedIngredients.original: 1 1/4 pounds frozen shelled edamame (4 cups), thawed

extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulbs
extendedIngredients.original: 2 fennel bulbs—trimmed, cored and very thinly sliced (6 cups)
extendedIngredients.originalName: fennel bulbs—trimmed, cored and very thinly sliced

extendedIngredients.name: lemons
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large lemons, very thinly sliced (preferably on a mandoline)
extendedIngredients.originalName: lemons, very thinly sliced (preferably on a mandoline)

extendedIngredients.name: salt and pepper
extendedIngredients.original: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
extendedIngredients.originalName: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: sriracha
extendedIngredients.original: 2 teaspoons Sriracha or other hot sauce

title: Edamame, Celery and Fennel Salad with Candied Lemon
summary: Edamame, Celery and Fennel Salad with Candied Lemon is a gluten free and vegan side dish. One portion of this dish contains around 8g of protein, 8g of fat, and a total of 213 calories. This recipe serves 12. For $1.29 per serving, this recipe covers 17% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Food and Wine has 1 fans. Head to the store and pick up soy sauce, sriracha, granulated sugar, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 1 hour. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 60%. This score is solid. Try Asian Celery, Fennel, and Edamame Salad with Candied Lemon, from 'Flour, Too, Celery Fennel Salad with Preserved Lemon and Dates, and Celery Apple Edamame Peanut Butter Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the lemon slices with 1 cup of the sugar and 2 cups of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the lemons are translucent and the liquid is syrupy, about 30 minutes. Let the lemons cool completely in the syrup, then transfer the lemons to a cutting board and finely chop them. Reserve the lemon syrup for another use.                                              Meanwhile, bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat. Add the edamame and cook until they are tender, about 2 minutes. Drain and cool the edamame under running water; pat dry. Transfer the edamame to a large bowl. Add the sliced celery, fennel, parsley and shallot.                                              In a small bowl, whisk the soy sauce with the rice vinegar, sesame oil, Sriracha and the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar; season the dressing lightly with salt and pepper. Whisk in the chopped candied lemon. Add the dressing to the salad and toss well to coat thoroughly. Sprinkle the salad with the white and black sesame seeds and serve right away.

steps.step: In a large saucepan, combine the lemon slices with 1 cup of the sugar and 2 cups of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the lemons are translucent and the liquid is syrupy, about 30 minutes.
Let the lemons cool completely in the syrup, then transfer the lemons to a cutting board and finely chop them. Reserve the lemon syrup for another use.
Meanwhile, bring a large saucepan of water to a boil over high heat.
Add the edamame and cook until they are tender, about 2 minutes.
Drain and cool the edamame under running water; pat dry.
Transfer the edamame to a large bowl.
Add the sliced celery, fennel, parsley and shallot.
In a small bowl, whisk the soy sauce with the rice vinegar, sesame oil, Sriracha and the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar; season the dressing lightly with salt and pepper.
Whisk in the chopped candied lemon.
Add the dressing to the salad and toss well to coat thoroughly.
Sprinkle the salad with the white and black sesame seeds and serve right away.
